review_title: My Experience has Been Awesome, so far
pros: Paid Time Off Supports Work/Life Balance In addition to PTO, full-time employees get 10 days paid off for Winter Break/Christmas and Fridays off in the Summer with a 36-hour work week and get paid for 40. Supportive Co-Workers and a Caring Community Work Feels Rewarding/Positive Open to Hybrid Work Schedule Good Benefits Invests in Employee's Professional Development and Continuing Education
cons: Experience Depends on Management and Type of Position You Have

pros: Meet people in the industry
cons: Seemingly an overall lack of appreciation.

review_title: Be prepared to be used and discarded
pros: Some good faculty, if you ever encounter them.
cons: Horrible support of faculty, HR dehumanizes employees, hard work not appreciated.

pros: Aims Community College has established an incredible work culture! I enjoyed working with every single individual both in the Financial Aid Office and the other departments we worked alongside with. I was very happy with my work study employment, and made amazing connections and friendships there that I will always be incredibly grateful for! Aims genuinely values their employees and due to that, I look for that same type of culture in jobs that I am currently looking for.
cons: There are no cons to this job.

pros: Works with availability very well
cons: Sometimes there are lulls through out the day where there is not much to do

review_title: Good workplace, change needed regarding change
pros: Great benefits, good coworking environment
cons: Communication can be an issue

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Greeley, CO
pros: Aims gives a lot of autonomy to instructors. Student success is a high priority in that they believe in supporting students, not just pushing them along or letting them sink.
cons: This isn't specific to Aims, but instructors and professors are consistently underpaid for the behind the scenes work that they do.

pros:
Best supervisor I ever had and was super flexible with my school schedule. 
Never felt rushed to get things done
cons: I wish I could choose to not get retirement taken out of pay

pros: 2 hard days off per week, set schedule for the entire semester, amazing pay, amazing benefits (health and dental insurance at no cost to the employee), pension plan, oldest aircraft in fleet is 2017
cons: Barely get to fly. Instructors average 30 hours per month. Not impossible to fly 50-80 hours, but that usually only happens to one instructor (out of ten) per month.

pros: The employees and community are top of the line, there is no competition among co-workers and everyone tries to help each other become better instructors.
cons: The flight program is growing too fast and the management has lost sight of taking care of the students. More focused on growth and less focused on student needs and the reality of their progression in the program.

pros: good, good, good ,good, good, good
cons: nothing, nothing, nothing, nothing, nothing

pros: Lots of professional development opportunities
cons: Few opportunities to advance internally

pros: Above average pay, excellent benefits
cons: Still dealing with weird COVID protocols

pros: Excellent place to work. Great communication and professional development. Employee voices heard and respected.
cons: Lack of benefits for part time adjunct instructors.

pros: Great place to learn. Treat employees well.
cons: Not a whole lot, good place.

review_title: Plenty of time away from work, but not enough compensation to do much with it.
pros: Plenty of vacation and other benefits are good. Management expects you to leave when the clock tells you your day is done. Most management is fairly flexible with their people.
cons: Administrative side is afraid of faculty voting them out of a job, which makes any drastic change unlikely. Business practices are nearly a decade behind, but if you want to feel stagnant, this is the place to be. Despite the benefits being great, almost every position in the college is paid $5,000 to $15,000 less than an equivalent position with nearly identical benefits in the same city. There is very little room to grow in your career.

pros: There are a few great people to work with.
cons: The overhead of doing your job is to painful. There is a culture of the person who screams the loudest is the person we make happy.

review_title: Change in administration has made environment toxic
pros: tuition reimbursement for employees, benefits, and vacation accrual, summer 4-day week schedule
cons: favoritism in hiring practices, no work-family/life balance, unrealistic expectations from managers and administrators, low pay for professional staff

pros: I enjoyed working as a math tutor at AIMS. The hours I worked were flexible.
cons: The pay and the fact that it was part time is what made me leave after working there for a year.

review_title: My experience with Aims has been amazing! The people are fantastic and personable and I love teaching with them :)
job_title: Psychology Instructor in Fort Collins, CO
pros: Great people, great environment and a general sense of family amongst the employees :)
cons: I'll let you know when I find one!

pros:
- Great benefits
- Great people
cons:
- Pay
- No opportunity to move up
-Changes are slow to happen

review_title: Not a place for a career
pros: Hours of operation went with the public school schedule
cons: Not a lot of regulation. Rules changed on a whim.

pros: Great community feel. The institution is very committed to professional development and is very supportive of employees
cons: The only downside for me is that it is far from Lakewood

pros: The mixture of students from different background makes working at Aims exciting.
cons: I'm not sure there are any.

pros: Good pay, good benefits, fair board of directors and executive management
cons: It's located in Greeley, Colorado

review_title: Part 141 flight school in Fort Collins, Colorado
job_title: Flight Instructor in Fort Collins, CO
pros: New equipment and a friendly atmosphere.
cons: Currently going through some growing pains.

pros: Easy to work with. Fast to process the paperwork
cons: I didn't have any negative experiences

review_title: There's some kind of pathology at this place
pros: Great insurance. Well known.  Free classes.
cons: The President fired the CIO in the middle of his retirement announcement. Over half the people that I worked with have all been fired. Turnover is rampant.
